channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023090195
item.description:
Report E-2023090195

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon bucket of acetone was damaged during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES&H to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed that the released material evaporated prior to their arrival and there was no recoverable material remaining in the trailer. One (1) 5-gallon bucket of product was punctured and released all its contents. No other buckets were damaged and the crew determined it was safe for the driver to continue to his destination. The terminal manager indicated they would offload the freight there and repackage as needed.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in QA damage area with the top portion of a torn box taped to a repack box containing plastic bottles of Nu Brite Coil Condenser Cleaner. DescribePack: Upon inspection, wet spots were found on the outside of the bottles. None were actively leaking but 2 were slightly less full than the others. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading from box. Package was placed in a salvage drum during inspection.

item.title: Report E-2023090193
item.description:
Report E-2023090193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: AMARILLO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 30, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the concrete surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surface. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum. The crew then deployed granular absorbents to the concrete and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents and clean up debris were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew returned the next day to commence power washing procedures. A boom was deployed to contain the area while crews pressure washed. One hundred and fifty (150) gallons of paint-rinseate were collected into three (3) 55-gallon drums. One (1) drum of spent absorbents, boom, and cleanup debris was also generated as waste. All four (4) 55-gallon drums of waste were staged on-site for further handling by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report E-2023090130
item.description:
Report E-2023090130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and hit the hose adaptor. This caused the connection between the hose adaptor and storage tank to become compromised. Approximately 10 gallons of gasoline was released. The Harris County Hazmat team responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2023080932
item.description:
Report X-2023080932

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080932 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0435 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: The inner item is a 2.5-gal plastic container that had a loose cap that allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out wetting the outer package. Top corner of the package is wet and appears to be tearing/coming apart. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. 2. X-2023080933 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0331 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: The inner item is a 2.5-gal plastic container that had a loose cap that allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out wetting the outer package. One side of the packaging was completely wet and ripped/torn DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. 3. X-2023080935 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0408 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. Top corner of the package by the FedEx label appears crushed and wet. Side of package has a wet stain and appears to be coming apart. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue wa

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drum of resin (un1993) releasing 10 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090000
item.description:
Report E-2023090000

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: ODESSA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LMD experienced a UN1992 CORR21262WR release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released impacting a 20 x 20 area of the concrete dock floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The salvaged product was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023081014
item.description:
Report E-2023081014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 28, 2023 at 1408 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo , Texas regarding the release of approximately (10) gallons of Yellow 30C236 in HV4187-Polycon (UN1263, Paint, 3, III) I) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor, the underside of the truck, and a small area of asphalt under the trailer. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080994
item.description:
Report E-2023080994

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a battery acid release from a 1044-pound UN2794 Battery, filled with acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released impacting an 8 x 8 area of the trailer floor and a 5 x 3 area of the concrete lot below due to improper loading. The impacted areas were neutralized with sodium bicarbonate and then collected with absorbents. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged battery was shrink wrapped with absorbent pads and secured to a pallet. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023080047
item.description:
Report I-2023080047

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: LONGVIEW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Description: On July 2, 2023 at approximately 7:15 PM, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling southbound on State Highway 42 in Gregg County, TX. At the intersection of Hwy 42 and Texaco Rd, a 2012 Nissan traveling east on Texaco Rd failed to stop at a stop sign and collided with Plains transport, causing the tank trailer to separate from the tractor and roll over into the ditch. Upon separation, the landing gear broke off and punctured a 3x3 inch hole in the trailer, at the 7 o'clock position if upright, but upon roll over, puncture was located at the 10 o'clock position. As a result of the collision, 70 gallons of diesel from the transport fuel tank and approximately 2 gallons of hydraulic fluid, from the trailer hydraulic pump and lines, were released to the roadway and roadside ditch. The Plains vehicle and the other vehicle were non drivable and had to be towed from the scene. An absorbent was applied to the roadway to encapsulate the diesel and hydraulic fluid, then swept and contained in 55 gallon drums. The impacted roadside ditch has been excavated to remove impacted soil and manifested for disposal, in accordance with TCEQ clean-up criteria. . . The Plains employee was injured and treated at a medical facility. Occupant of other vehicle perished at the scene.
